Class KK_ServerProtocol

  • java.lang.Object
    • KK_ServerProtocol

  • public class KK_ServerProtocol
extends java.lang.Object
    KK_ServerProtocol provides the serverside KnockKnock logic. This provides the initial clue, and the knockknock content. The KnockKnock data content is stored on a properties file. Randomization provides a mechanism to ensure uniqueness in the jokes for each client connection. Additionally the ServerProtocol also maintains that state logic for each question/response sequence.
    Author:
    notroot

    • Constructor Detail

      • KK_ServerProtocol

        public KK_ServerProtocol()
                  throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                         java.io.IOException
        Constructor uses a properties file for storing and sharing the knock knock jokes. These are read from a file and using comma delimiters, are arranged into a double array for both CLUE's and ANSWERS
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - when properties file is not found
        java.io.IOException - when input / output issus

    • Method Detail

      • processInput

        public java.lang.String processInput(java.lang.String theInput)
                              throws java.io.FileNotFoundException,
                                     java.io.IOException
        This is the information output returned to the console window. This provides information about the server's operations and the uniqueness for each client connection. The DEBUG statements were removed, however this also shows the console state of operation of the actual KnockKnock application. Additionally it performs all the logic and state calculations.
        Parameters:
        theInput - response received from the client connection
        Returns:
        output joke response to the client depending on state of joke
        Throws:
        java.io.FileNotFoundException - when properties file is not available
        java.io.IOException - when input/output errors.

      • fetchArrayFromPropFile

        private static java.lang.String[][] fetchArrayFromPropFile(java.lang.String propertyName,
                                                           java.util.Properties propFile)
        Creates two dimensional array from delineated string in properties file
        Parameters:
        propertyName - name of the property as in the file
        propFile - the instance of the Properties file that has the property
        Returns:
        two dimensional array
